No. This is a known issue but does not affect the performance of the software. This will be solved in the next version of nordicAktiva.

Yes! Open the C Drive on the nordicComfortPlayer’s PC and there you will find two folders: ‘movies’ and ‘music’. Copy your desired video or audio files into these folders accordingly. For videos, you can choose if you want to add the new files to the ‘general’ or ‘children’ folder. After adding the files, start nordicComfortPlayer and you should be able to see and play the newly added videos or audio files in the media library.
Yes. There is a standard HDMI connection to the LCD in the control room. Just plug the HDMI cable into your computer, and the LCD can be used in the same way as any other second monitor.

Yes, all nordicAktiva paradigms can be displayed on the VisualSystem HD goggles. The HDMI output of the nordicAktiva PC can be connected to a splitter, which then gives rise to two identical HDMI outputs, one for each of the two independent displays. More information can be found in the ‘Display Setup for VisualSystem HD’ guide on our website. If you have both the LCD monitor and the VisualSystem HD goggles and need to switch often between them, you can add an HDMI switch to smoothly transfer the display from one to the other.
Questin: Can I display paradigms from nordicAktiva on the VisualSystem HD goggles?

bot_response:
Yes, the SyncBox can forward the MR-triggers to other equipment, e.g., an EEG system. There are, however, different approaches depending on your setup:

  • If you are not using the ResponseGrips in your setup, then you can use the TTL port (9) on the SyncBox in order to forward the triggers. The TTL port should then be connected to the parallel port of your system.
  • You can also forward the received triggers using the serial port (4) on the SyncBox. Here you will need a serial cable which connects the SyncBox to your system.
Questin: Can I forward the received MR-triggers from the SyncBox to other equipment?

bot_response:
Yes, it is possible to install nordicAktiva on computers other than that provided by NordicNeuroLab. Below are the minimum requirements:

Operating system:

o Windows 7, 8.1, or 10

Hardware:

o Intel i3 processor or equivalent

o 4 GB RAM

o 100 MB of free space on hard disk

o DirectX 9 compatible graphics card with dual video outputs

o Audio outputs

o USB or serial port (for NNL SyncBox connection)

For further support, please contact us at applicationsupport@nordicneurolab.com.
Questin: Can I install nordicAktiva on another computer?

bot_response: Yes, it is possible to use the NNL ResponseGrips with other stimulus software packages, such as PsychoPy, Presentation, and E-Prime. Responses from ResponseGrips are received by the ResponseGrip Interface. It then forwards the received responses to the NNL SyncBox, which in turn forwards them to the stimulation PC. This means that you need to connect and set up your stimulation software with the NNL SyncBox. For setup instructions, please visit our website, where different guides are available. We are constantly expanding and updating these guides. If you are interested in specific software for which a guide is not available on our website, please contact us at applicationsupport@nordicneurolab.com.
Questin: Can I use the ResponseGrips with other stimulus presentation software packages?

bot_response: Yes, SyncBox can be used in conjunction with other stimulus software packages, such as E-Prime, Presentation, and PsychoPy. You can find different setup instructions on our website, which we are constantly expanding and updating. If you are interested in specific software for which a guide is not available on our website, please contact us at applicationsupport@nordicneurolab.com.
Questin: Can I use the SyncBox with other stimulus presentation software applications?

bot_response: nordicAktiva does not support any control of the paradigm content by the subject. The ResponseGrips can be used to indicate a response to a given slide, but it is not possible to include conditional statements such as if.... else.
Questin: Can subject responses be used to control the content of the paradigm?

bot_response:
If you want to upgrade your nordicComfortSolution to a Basic fMRI Solution, you will need to add the SyncBox and ResponseGrips, and nordicAktiva. The SyncBox provides precise synchronization of the stimuli with the MRI scan, while the ResponseGrips allow patients to respond to the stimuli during the scan. The nordicAktiva software provides a wide range of stimulus presentation options, making it easy to create and present stimuli during fMRI scans.

To get a quote on upgrading your nordicComfortSolution, we recommend contacting your local sales representative.
They will be able to provide you with pricing and other information about the necessary components and software.
Questin: Can the nordicComfortSolution be upgraded to be used for fMRI?

bot_response:
To see the screen while laying inside the bore, a mirror is necessary.
If the MR vendor does not provide a mirror, NordicNeuroLab can provide a mirror option.
Questin: Do we need a mirror?

bot_response:
We do have additional paradigms available to test, and we welcome feedback on these.
Please navigate to the ‘Paradigm Exchange’ page on NNL Forum to access these paradigms.

If you have any further needs or suggestions, please get in touch via applicationsupport@nordicneurolab.com.
Questin: Do you have other paradigms which are not in the library?

bot_response: No, at the moment the only available response devices we have are the ergonomic ResponseGrips. If you are interested in any other response button devices, please feel free to let us know at applicationsupport@nordicneurolab.com, as we welcome suggestions for future developments.
Questin: Do you have other response devices?
Does nordicAktiva support devices from other vendors?
bot_response:
No, every input to nordicAktiva has to come from the NNL SyncBox serial port.

‍

Questin: How can eye tracking be done with the VisualSystem HD goggles?
bot_response: The VisualSystem HD goggles feature eye-tracking cameras only, and different users may deploy their own choice of eye-tracking analysis software. However, we do partner with Arrington Research Inc, who offer the ViewPoint eye-tracking solution, which we sell l for use with the VisualSystem HD. We have created a user guide on our website, where you can find all the necessary steps for integrating ViewPoint with the VisualSystem HD goggles.

Questin: How can I add local radio stations to nordicComfortPlayer?
bot_response:
Follow these steps:

  1. First you need to know the URL address of the radio station you would like to add. Note that the URL address needs to be exactly the streaming link, like ‘http://http-live.sr.se/p1-mp3-192’ in the example below. Otherwise, it won’t be played when you select it in nordicComfortPlayer.
  1. Go to C:\Users\AppData\Local\ComfortPlayer and open ‘settigs.json’ file with Notepad. Scroll down and find the section where all the radio stations are located. The section starts with the syntax "radio".  
  1. Under this section you can add you desired radio station. Below is a syntax example that shows how the URL should be added. In front of "title", you can give a name to the new radio station, which will then appear in the media library of nordicComfortPlayer.

       {

           "title": "Sverige Radio P1",

           "url": "http://http-live.sr.se/p1-mp3-192"

       },

  1. Save the changes and start nordicComfortPlayer. You should be able to see and play the new radio station.

‍

Questin: How can I change the image orientation on the LCD monitor?
bot_response:
There are two ways to change the orientation of the image:

  • If you have nordicComfortPlayer, open the app and select one of the icons on the top right according to whether the screen is at the patient’s head or feet, and whether you have a single or double mirror.
  • If you do not have the nordicComfortPlayer app, there are flip/rotate controls on the LCD as well. You can use the touch buttons on the front top left corner of the LCD to adjust the orientation (see the table below for the functionality of the touch buttons). Activate the on-screen menu and then navigate to and enter the ‘other’ submenu. Then enter the ‘Display rotation’ option and choose one of the four orientation options (normal, H, V, H/V). The selected setting is stored and will be retained after power cycling.

‍

In both approaches, always check with patients if they can see everything in the correct orientation.

‍

Questin: How can I make my paradigms available to others on the NNL forum?
bot_response: We would love for you to share your own paradigms on our forum and can help you link up with other interested users who may be working on similar experiments. Please zip your paradigm folder and upload it here. We will then be in touch.

Questin: How can I quickly switch to nordicAktiva when nordicComfortPlayer is running?
bot_response:
nordicComfortPlayer and nordicAktiva should not be open at the same time, as this may result in conflicts with the in-room display settings.

‍

Questin: How can I send data from PACS to nordicBrainEx?
bot_response: The nordicBrainEx workstation needs to be registered in your PACS system. The network information of the nordicBrainEx workstation can be found in nordicBrainEx under File/Database/Settings tab and then under the ‘Database’ section.

Questin: How can I suggest a change to the nordicAktiva paradigm library?
bot_response:
Your feedback is very much appreciated!
Please get in touch via applicationsupport@nordicneurolab.com if you see that something is not quite as it should be or doesn’t meet your needs.

Questin: How close can the LCD monitor be positioned to the MR-bore?
bot_response: Bringing the LCD monitor closer to the bore than the legs of the stand allow will introduce a high potential risk of damaging the LCD. As a rule of thumb, 10 cm clearance is recommended between the wheels of the LCD stand and the end of the bore.

Questin: How do I create a design file to feed into nordicBrainEx?
bot_response: Once the paradigm has completed, click ‘Save Results’. Then via the File menu, click on ‘Browse log and design files’. The design files will be marked as ‘.des’ with the date and time appended. These can be transferred to your nordicBrainEx workstation by USB drive or similar.

Questin: How does nordicBrainEx do the Co-registration and motion correction?
bot_response: Motion correction and Co-registration in nordicBrainEx are based on rigid body transformation.  Co-registration aligns the dynamic images with the structural image. Motion correction on the other hand, aligns all the dynamic image to the first volume within the dynamic series, and generates the translation and rotation parameters.

Questin: How does the nordicComfortSolution improve the patient experience during MRI scans?
bot_response: The nordicComfortSolution is designed to help reduce anxiety and discomfort during MRI scans by providing patients with a distracting and enjoyable experience. By providing patients with entertainment options, the system can help them relax and remain still during the scanning process, which can lead to better imaging results.

Questin: How does the nordicComfortSolution work?
bot_response:
The nordicComfortSolution is a hardware- and software-based system. You have the MR compatible LCD installed inside the MR room that displays the content and it is connected to a computer tablet that can be controlled from inside the Control Room. The radiographer can select the entertainment options from a user-friendly interface and the patient gets to enjoy them during the scan.

‍

Questin: How is leakage correction done in nordicBrainEx DSC?
bot_response:
Leakage correction is very important for DSC perfusion analysis, especially in relation to tumors. Tumors have leaky vasculature and so the contrast agent leaks into extravascular extracellular space and accumulates there. The leakage can lead to over- or underestimation of the cerebral blood volume (CBV), and therefore it is important to correct it. The leakage correction for DSC in nordicBrainEx is based on the residual function described in this article by Bjørnerud et al. (2011). In brief, the method uses the tail of the residual function to estimate the leakage, and unlike the commonly used Weiskoff method, it does not assume a constant mean transit time for all tissue types. More information can be found here.

‍

Questin: How is normalization done in nordicBrainEx DSC?
bot_response: When normalization is selected, nordicBrainEx normalizes CBV and CBF maps to the normal appearing white and grey matter. The software segments out tumor, blood vessels, and normal-appearing grey and white matter, before dividing the CBV and CBF by the average value within the normal-appearing grey and white matter. A VOI can therefore be drawn in a relevant area of pathology and the mean value may be taken without manually normalizing to a second VOI placed within normal tissue. It can be used to significantly speed up the reporting workflow. More information can be found here.

Questin: How is permeability calculated in nordicBrainEx DCE?
bot_response:
The DCE module uses a two-compartment exchange (TCx) pharmacokinetic model (Sourbron S, 2009). In brief, the model can be illustrated in the following way:

Where the contrast agent (C) enters the capillary volume due to tissue blood flow (F) and is initially distributed in the tissue plasma volume (Vp), but is gradually equilibrated to the extracellular, extravascular space with volume fraction of Ve, at a rate determined by rate constants Ktrans and kep.

More information can be found here.

‍

Questin: I don’t see the patient camera feed. What should I do?
bot_response: Go to nordicComfortPlayer’s settings (gear icon on the lower-left hand side), select the correct camera from the dropdown menu, and set it as default. The patient camera is usually labeled as ‘USB CAMERA’ in the dropdown menu list. When this is done, select the camera icon on the upper-left hand side. You should then be able to see the camera feed.

Questin: I had to stop my experiment before the scan was completed. Can I still save my results?
bot_response: Yes! If you need to stop nordicAktiva manually, you can still manually proceed to the final screen using the forward arrow, where you can then ‘Save results’ as normal.

Questin: I have created a new paradigm. Why can’t I see it in the library?
bot_response: Make sure the ‘main’ file name is identical to the name of the paradigm folder, then restart or refresh nordicAktiva (via the red button on the top right).

Questin: Is it possible to make event-related paradigms in nordicAktiva?
bot_response: Paradigms in nordicAktiva can be made up of blocks, individual trials, or a combination of the two. This means you can create trials which are short ‘events’, with flexible timing, thus making a form of event-related paradigm. For further information and support please consult our paradigm syntax documentation.

Questin: Is the nordicComfortSolution compatible with all types of MRI scanners?
bot_response:
The nordicComfortSolution is compatible with a wide range of MRI scanners,including 0.55T, 1.5T, 3T, and 7T scanners.
It has been tested and approved on scanners from Siemens Healthineers, GE Healthcare, and Philips.

Questin: Is the nordicComfortSolution easy to install and maintain?
bot_response: The nordicComfortSolution is designed with easy installation and maintenance in mind. The software is preinstalled on a tablet, which is placed in the control room. The InroomViewingDevice is mounted on a stand, with wheels, and can be rolled into the MRI room. The tablet and the InroomViewingDevice, which provides the patient with the entertainment, are connected via a fiber optic cable that runs through a wave-guide.

Questin: Why does nordicAktiva frequently warn that it has lost connection to the SyncBox. Is there a problem with the connection?
bot_response:
Ensure your Virtual COM Port drivers are up to date.
Information on the required drivers is found here.

Questin: The paradigm language I would like to use is not available. What options do I have?
bot_response:
We are constantly updating our library and are interested in your needs regarding language implementations.
Please contact us applicationsupport@nordicneurolab.com to make a request or to discuss how you can implement your required language yourself.

Questin: The SyncBox doesn’t send the ‘s’ character to the stimulation PC. What should I do?
bot_response: If the connection between the SyncBox and PC is established but the ‘s’ char is not sent, you can factory reset the SyncBox. The factory reset option can be found on the on-screen ‘Option Menu’ of the SyncBox. After resetting the SyncBox, reboot the PC and all the associated hardware including the SyncBox.

Questin: What are the pros and cons of DSC and DCE?
bot_response: DSC uses T2* based perfusion, while DCE uses T1 based perfusion. While DSC has a higher contrast agent sensitivity and higher temporal resolution, DCE offers better image quality and more linear dose-response. As DCE takes longer than DSC, its acquisition doesn’t always cover the whole brain but instead a few slices are acquired around the tumor to save time.

Questin: What can I do if nordicAktiva does not proceed to 'Save results’ after the paradigm finishes?
bot_response: This might sometimes happen when using the ‘Triggers on every block’ option in the Scanner Settings. If you would like to save your results (log and design files) on completion of a paradigm, but nordicAktiva remains on the ‘Run paradigm’ screen, you can manually proceed to the ‘Save results’ screen using the forward arrow.

Questin: What can I do if nordicAktiva doesn’t recognize the SyncBox?
bot_response:
Try the following steps:

1. Go to Edit/Settings and under the ‘SyncBox’ tab click on ‘Auto detect’. You should then see a message confirming which port the SyncBox is connected to. After confirming this message, you should be able to see the COM port under ‘Serial/USB port’ dropdown menu. Click on ‘Apply’ and ‘Ok’.

2. If it still doesn’t solve the issue, check the connection between the mini USB port on the side of the SyncBox and the USB port of the PC.

3. Verify that the SyncBox is listed correctly in the ‘Device Manager’ on Windows. Restart the SyncBox and nordicAktiva PC and re-check the above settings in nordicAktiva.

‍

Questin: What is HID mode and how can I operate the SyncBox in this mode?
bot_response: Using the USB cable, SyncBox versions 3.2.0 and older can be recognized by the stimulus presentation PC as a Human Interface Device (HID)/keyboard. The version of the SyncBox can be found on the label underneath. When operating in the HID mode, the SyncBox sends out the letter ‘s’ to the stimulus presentation PC, when a trigger is received from the MR scanner. The ‘HID’ mode needs to be set in the ‘Options menu’ of the SyncBox, but unlike serial mode, no driver is required here.

Questin: What is serial mode and how can I set up the SyncBox in this mode?
bot_response: Serial communication can be established by connecting the mini-USB port on the side of the SyncBox to a USB port on the stimulus presentation PC, which allows for two-way communication between them. In serial mode, the SyncBox can be completely controlled by the stimulus presentation PC and sends out the ASCII code of the character ‘s’, when it receives a trigger from the scanner. For serial communication, the SyncBox needs to be set to ‘Serial’ using its on-screen ‘Options menu’. In addition, to operate the SyncBox in serial mode via USB, Virtual COM Port drivers need to be installed. Make sure that the updated drivers are installed and verify that the SyncBox is listed correctly in the ‘Device Manager’ on Windows. The latest driver can be downloaded from this link.

Questin: What is the most effective way to rehearse the task with the patient before the exam?
bot_response:
You can sit with the patient and use nordicAktiva in ‘Preview without SyncBox’ mode.
Run through a few slides of the first active block with them and ask them to perform the task overtly with you.

Alternatively, the ‘fMRI Task Instructions’ document can be used as a guide to sit and explain what the patient can expect.

In either situation, you should ask the patient to rehearse by either showing you the relevant movement they are required to do or giving responses to examples of the language tasks out loud.

‍

‍

‍

‍

Questin: What other software applications can I use with the VisualSystemHD goggles?
bot_response: Different software packages can be used with our VisualSystemHD goggles such as PsychoPy, Psychtoolbox, Stereoscopic Player or Unity. Guidance documentation can be found here, and is constantly being expanded and updated. If you are interested in specific software for which a guide is not available on our website, please contact us at applicationsupport@nordicneurolab.com.

Questin: What types of entertainment options are available on the nordicComfortSolution?
bot_response: The nordicComfortSolution includes a wide range of entertainment options, including relaxing movies, music, opportunity to add streaming platforms, and more. Patients can choose from avariety of options to find the ones that best suit their preferences and needs.

Questin: What is the nordicComfortSolution?
bot_response: The nordicComfortSolution is a patient entertainment system developed by NordicNeuroLab to improve the patient experience during MRI scans. The system provides a variety of entertainment options, such as movies, and music, which can help distract patients and reduce anxiety during the scanning process.

Questin: Which MR head coils can be used with the VisualSystem HD?
bot_response: We have different adapters available to make it possible for the VisualSystem HD to be mounted on a variety of MR head coils. Feel free to get in touch with us at applicationsupport@nordicneurolab.com, if you need more information for your setup.

Questin: Why can’t my computer detect the nordicBrainEx network license?
bot_response:
First check that both computers are on the same network. Then follow the steps below on your computer, i.e., the computer which does not have the license key connected to it.

  1. Open License Admin Control Center.
  2. Click on Sentinel Keys in the top left.
  • This page shows all the NNL licenses this computer has access to.
  • Check if you do see a license listed here with an ID that has less than 12 digits. The 12 digits (or longer) are demo licenses installed when the software was first installed.
  • If you do not see your license, continue to step 3.
  1. Click on 'Configuration'.
  1. Select 'Access to remote License Managers'.
  1. Make sure the following are all checked:
  • Allow Access to Remote Licenses
  • Broadcast Search for Remote Licenses
  • Aggressive Search for Remote Licenses
  1. In the field next to 'Remote License Search Parameters' enter in the IP address of the computer that has the license key physically connected to it.
  1. Click Submit. It may take a few minutes before it finds the license key. Check back under Sentinel Keys.

‍

Questin: Why do I not see any image on the LCD monitor?
bot_response: First check your computer ‘Display settings’. If the LCD monitor is recognized, you should be able to see two monitors under ‘System/Display’, one for the stimulation PC and one for the LCD. You can click on ‘Identify’ to check the allocated number for each display. If you still don’t see any image on the LCD monitor, check the video and power cables to the LCD, power supply (LPS), fiber transmitter (usually placed under the desk in the control room), and nordicAktiva PC (HDMI output), and make sure that they are correctly connected. On the fiber transmitter, both green LED (power) and blue LED (fiber/data) should be on.

Questin: Why do I see an ‘Out of Memory’ warning in nordicBrainEx?
bot_response:
The software is a 32-bit application. If your underlying structural data has a high in-plane resolution, the maps used as overlays may be significantly up-sampled, which can cause memory issues.Under ‘Settings’, select ’Limit displayed resolution in MPR’ to downsample your underlay image to a lower resolution.

If the problem remains, try loading fewer image series at one time. It may also help to limit the number of BOLD overlays that are visualized at the same time, if they are of a particularly high resolution or remove any derived data once they are saved into the database.

Questin: Why does my paradigm not appear to synchronize with BOLD acquisition?
bot_response:
There may be a few reasons.

· If your paradigm is starting of its own accord before the scan starts, ensure the Run Mode (Edit menu) is set to Synchronize.

· If the paradigm is stuck on the ‘Starting soon’ slide, ensure that your scanner is giving out a trigger signal at the start of data acquisition.

· For Philips scanners, the ‘Sync. Ext. Trig’ option needs to be enabled within the BOLD protocol.

· The scanner will complete a number of dummy scans prior to starting the acquisition of images. It may then appear as though the paradigm is not starting at the start of the scan; however, you should see that once your first real measurement is being acquired, the paradigm starts.

‍

Questin: Why does nordicAktiva not see the LCD monitor?
bot_response:
Try the following steps:

1. Go to Edit/Settings and under the ‘Displays’ tab and select the correct patient display. The patient display is usually the number ‘2’.

2. If you don’t see ‘2’ in the dropdown menu, go to Windows ‘Display settings’ and check if it shows the second monitor. You can check the numbering of the monitors by clicking on ‘Identify’, where a number is allocated to each connected monitor.

3. If you don’t see the second monitor, make sure the LCD power supply in the MR room is on and all the connections are in place. This includes the HDMI connection between the nordicAktiva PC and the Fiber Transmitter as well as the connection between the power supply and the LCD monitor.

‍

Questin: Why does the video feed from the LCD camera look blurry or pixelated in nordicComfortPlayer?
bot_response: This could be due to data accumulation along the route from the camera to the Fiber Transmitter (usually placed under the desk in the control room) and back to the PC, where nordicComfortPlayer is installed. Close the nordicComfortPlayer, and then disconnect and reconnect the power supply on the Fiber Transmitter. Wait a few seconds and then open the nordicComfortPlayer again. This should solve the issue.

Questin: Why is playback of my slides not as I expect?
bot_response: If your paradigm includes large audio or video files, there are limitations which can cause some unpredictable behavior. There may be a number of solutions depending on the content. One potential solution is to create and load a long video or audio file for the entire paradigm instead of using multiple video or audio files. For further assistance, please contact our application scientists at applicationsupport@nordicneurolab.com.
